Annotation.note:
The paper [BIB/Bachmann_98a]
Abstract: Monomial representations and operations for Gr\"obner bases computations are investigated from an implementation point of view. The technique of vectorized monomial operations is introduced and it is shown how it expedites computations of Gr\"obner bases. Furthermore, a rank-based monomial representation and comparison technique is examined and it is concluded that this technique does not yield an additional speedup over vectorized comparisons. Extensive benchmark tests with the Computer Algebra System {\sc Singular} are used to evaluate these concepts.
It is the primary source for the following examples:
Singular.ecyclic_5 Singular.ecyclic_6 Singular.ecyclic_7 Singular.gerhard_1 Singular.gerhard_2 Singular.gerhard_3 Singular.rcyclic_8 Singular.rcyclic_9 Singular.rcyclic_10 Singular.rcyclic_11 Singular.rcyclic_12 Singular.rcyclic_13 Singular.rcyclic_14 Singular.rcyclic_15 Singular.rcyclic_16 Singular.rcyclic_17 Singular.rcyclic_18 Singular.rcyclic_19 Singular.schwarz_6 Singular.schwarz_7 Singular.schwarz_8 Singular.schwarz_9 Singular.schwarz_10 Singular.schwarz_11 Singular.ecyclic_5 (homogenized) Singular.ecyclic_6 (homogenized) Singular.ecyclic_7 (homogenized) Singular.schwarz_10 (homogenized) Singular.schwarz_11 (homogenized) Singular.schwarz_7 (homogenized) Singular.schwarz_8 (homogenized) Singular.schwarz_9 (homogenized)
